Sandra Oh confronts psychopath in hair-raising Killing Eve teaser  Entertainment Weekly News

“I know you are an extraordinary person,” Sandra Oh’s Eve says to begin the first trailer for Killing Eve. “I know something happened to you. item.description:
The comeback kids of Bafta crown a vintage year as top British actors earn award nominations  The Telegraph

The last time Jamie Bell was on the Bafta stage, he was a fresh-faced 14-year-old accepting his best actor trophy for his 2001 Billy Elliot debut. item.description:
The rom-com isn't dead: It's just become less recognisable  The Independent

Think of the term 'rom-com' and what springs to mind? Colin Firth and Hugh Grant in their prime? Meg Ryan faking orgasms for Billy Crystal or firing off wistful emails to Tom Hanks? Julia Roberts in Notting Hill or Renee Zellweger as Bridget Jones? The Wedding Singer, 50 First Dates or My Big Fat Greek Wedding? It was inevitable somebody would dig up Four Weddings and Funeral for a rehash, but this is something a surprise move. item.description:

Richard Curtis has signed on as executive producer to a TV series inspired by his film Four Weddings and a Funeral, which The Mindy Project's Mindy Kaling will write, Deadline Hollywood reports.
